page.title: 13LAVERNOCK NEAR LOWER PENARTH
page.content: Lavernock is a mile off the Penarth to Barry road.Lavernock Point is known locally because{Marconi}sent the first {radio message}over water from Flatholm island to Lavernock farm in 1897.A commemoration plaque is found on the church{wall.Lavernock holiday camp}has tents,well equipped bungalows and caravans.There are two bars,a shop a disco and swimming pool.Costs about Â£100 for a bungalow in July.Lavernock church,built in{1291}has marks in the stone work which are of{Celtic origin. Human remains found locally are people drowned in ship wrecks.Wreckers or smugglers were busy here,in the{18th {century.Flatholm island}was a haunt of{wreckers.First 90 ft lighthouse}was coal-fired.In 1819 gas lighting and a foghorn were added.There are remains of{pill boxes,part of coastal defence in WW2_two{Moncrieff gun pits}remain.
